How to make Github Pages

Posted in git  artical  and tagged github , pages , how on Nov 8, 2014

Install Ruby

Generally speaking, the Mac OS will have installed Ruby by default. To check, open Terminal and run command ‘ruby –version’


Install Bundler

$ gem install bundler


Install Jekyll

Create a file in repository called ‘Gemfile’ and add gem ‘github-pages’.

Before run the next line, check whether you have installed ‘xcode-select’ or not. If not, please install The command line tool for Xcode first by run 

$ xcode-select --install

Run 

$ bundle install


Run Jekyll

Run ‘bundle exec jekyll serve’ in Terminal Now, you can try to open http://localhost:4000/index.html to see your Github page.


Choose Theme

See here:

Jekyll Theme

Fork the theme you like, unzip it and copy them to your repository folder.


Ref:

  1. 一步步在GitHub上创建博客主页

  2. Using Jekyll with Pages

  3. 用Github Pages建独立博客

  4. 如何搭建一个独立博客——简明Github Pages与Hexo教程
